discoveredAssets: localhost:3000 - Web Application (AUTH 05) - Apache 2.4.25, PHP 5.6.40 - Port 3000 - Active
index.php - Authentication endpoint - GET method login with username/password parameters - Critical entry point
/static/ directory - Static assets directory (directory listing disabled) - Contains springfield_background.jpg
/static/springfield_background.jpg - Background image file (412KB JPEG) - Publicly accessible
/server-status - Apache server-status endpoint - 403 Forbidden (exists but access denied)
/.htaccess - Apache configuration file - 403 Forbidden (exists but access denied)

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass vulnerabilities (SQL injection, NoSQL injection in username/password parameters), authentication logic flaws, session management, brute force protection, and GET-based credential exposure. Verify if authentication can be bypassed to access admin functionality.
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint using insecure GET method for credentials. Application reveals authentication logic through error messages ('you are not the admin'). Different behavior with empty vs missing parameters suggests logic vulnerabilities. PHP 5.6.40 is severely outdated (EOL 2019) with known vulnerabilities. Authentication via GET exposes credentials in logs and browser history.

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure vulnerabilities, parameter manipulation, HTTP method tampering (OPTIONS, PUT, DELETE, TRACE), header injection, and outdated PHP/Apache version vulnerabilities (CVE testing for PHP 5.6.40 and Apache 2.4.25).
targets.rationale: Main application entry point running outdated PHP 5.6.40 (end-of-life since 2019) and Apache 2.4.25, both with known CVEs. Application may be vulnerable to outdated software exploits, information disclosure through verbose error messages, and improper HTTP method handling.

targets.objective: Test for directory traversal vulnerabilities, path manipulation to access files outside the static directory, and enumeration of additional static files that may contain sensitive information (source maps, config files, backup files).
targets.rationale: Static directory with directory listing disabled but individual files accessible. May contain additional sensitive files beyond the known background image. Directory traversal could potentially access files outside the intended static directory.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Authentication uses insecure GET method - Credentials exposed in URL, logs, browser history, and referrer headers at http://localhost:3000/index.php
[CRITICAL] Outdated PHP version 5.6.40 (End-of-Life since January 2019) - Known security vulnerabilities including CVE-2019-11043 (RCE), CVE-2019-11042, CVE-2019-11041, and others
[HIGH] Application reveals authentication logic - Error message 'you are not the admin' discloses that admin role exists and authentication checks are performed
[HIGH] Outdated Apache version 2.4.25 (released 2016) - May be vulnerable to known Apache CVEs depending on configuration
[HIGH] Different authentication behavior with missing vs empty parameters - May indicate logic vulnerabilities or parameter manipulation opportunities
[MEDIUM] Apache server-status endpoint exists (403 Forbidden) - If access is gained through misconfiguration or other vulnerability, sensitive server information would be exposed
[MEDIUM] POST method accepted but appears to ignore POST data - Application may have inconsistent request handling that could lead to security issues
[LOW] Directory listing disabled on /static/ - Proper security configuration, but individual files still accessible
[LOW] .htaccess file properly protected (403 Forbidden) - Good security practice
